column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What would be a bigger turn-off for you in bed , someone who was overly flatulent , or someone who spoke in a baby voice ?
#Text=I could get over the baby voice , but the flatulence is a tough one to stomach .
#Text=Do you have a favorite curse word ?
#Text=Nothing is springing to mind .
#Text=Favorite euphemism for breasts ?
#Text=Nope .
#Text=If you had to choose between the destruction of the entire continent of Africa or the entire continent of Asia , which would you choose ?
#Text=Oh , God .
#Text=So , population-wise .
#Text=It ’s tempting…I think that is the only way to choose .
#Text=Killing a greater number of people has to be a greater evil .
#Text=That ’s maybe the bottom line .
#Text=I would hate to make that decision .
#Text=What are traits you respect in a woman ?
#Text=The same traits I look for in anybody else in the world : kindness , thoughtfulness .
#Text=It does n’t differ in men ?
#Text=No.
#Text=Being a nice human being is what I look for in anybody .
#Text=What ’s your most treasured possession ?
#Text=I have a massive record collection I obsess over , and it would be hard to let that go .
#Text=Any favorite films ?
#Text=I have n't been able to see any in the last couple of months , but in the last year I went through a complete Herzog obsession .
#Text=I watched all of his films , I read Herzog on Herzog and even read Kinsky ’s biography .
#Text=Almost all of his films are incredible .
#Text=What difficult question in an interview do you anticipate but are never asked ?
#Text=I actually do n’t anticipate the difficult ones , which is why when you asked me to destroy one continent
#Text=I did n’t see that one coming .
#Text=What question are you tired of answering ?
#Text=The ones I get asked the most , and I do n’t mind answering them , but I do n’t relish answering them :
#Text=I had to change my name from Manitoba to Caribou a couple years back due a law suit .
#Text=I do n't mind this one anymore , but at first I got asked that in every interview .
#Text=And also , the connection between mathematics and music , which you asked me in a form .
#Text=That ’s a valid question , though , because it ’s a point of interest about the way that I work .
#Text=The lawsuit is like reciting a history of facts I ’d rather forget .
#Text=In the last year , where have you drawn most of your influence , and you ca n’t have been listening to them beyond a year ago .
#Text=The big thing for me in the last year that is reflected in this album more than in previous ones is songwriting .
#Text=I never wrote songs I just built tracks out of loops .
#Text=There were melodies in them , but there was n’t any structure to the songs .
#Text=One artist I did n’t ’ listen to before a year ago was Ariel Pink who is a lo-fi indie songwriter and producer .
#Text=His production is amazing , but it turns people off because it ’s so lo-fi ; but also , his song-writing is amazing .
